column4: Has anyone run virtual machine? is it fast enough to tolerate? is it possible to install applications on virtual OS and would that run fine?
Has anyone run virtual machine? is it fast enough to tolerate? is it possible to install applications on virtual OS and would that run fine?
abey o matthai
sure, they are ok, depends on config and designated resources
games run badly, the new virtualbox has an opengl implementation but ive not heard anything
hmw_: I want to run some office applications such as simply accounting etc. for a client, i want to make sure client does not lose data.
then it'll be fine, does the app not run via wine?
It is too slow in wine
then try a virtualbox
hmw_: thank you very much
you will be installing windows on linux so you will need a license
License for windows right?
yes as you will be installing it to th VM
wouldn't that license that originally came with their pc, when it was factory installed, work?
depends on the license you bought, windows licenses are weird
true
then i'll have to investigate on it
sounds like it, did you get wine from the wine repo
it seems slicker than the one on the ubuntu repo imho
I got it from ubuntu repo, should have tried other way

this may give better performance of the app
